title: Typeface used on cover of Wired Magazine, August 2008
author: paulclaytonsmith

comments.content: Hoefler & Frere-Jones did a some custom typefaces for them a while back. This is probably one of them. You might try something in the Univers family for an alternative.

Pulled the font name from a true PDF posted in another thread and it appears to be a custom font called ’Tungsten-Medium’.

[http://typophile.com/node/60752](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021340/http:/typophile.com/node/60752 "http://typophile.com/node/60752")

I just wanted to update this, since visiting H&FJ’s site moments ago, I was pleasantly greeted with the news of this: [http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100035](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021340/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100035)

I was just going to post.. someone tweeted about this exact same font earlier today and I followed it to the following..

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_styles.php?productLineID=100035&cpu...](http://web.archive.org/web/20090924021340/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?productLineID=100035&cpuCount=1 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_styles.php?productLineID=100035&cpuCount=1")
